授業目的: This course examines Chinese migration to Japan from the late Tokugawa period to the present. It approaches the subject from the perspectives of politics, economics, social relations, and culture. While grounded in history, this course seeks to elucidate patterns and trends relevant to present-day Japanese society. More broadly, it encourages students to reflect on the implications of immigration to Japan as a modern global phenomenon.
到達目標: By taking this course, students will gain a general understanding as well as critical insights into Chinese migration to Japan during the past century and half. Through presentations and writing assignments, students will be able to also improve on their skills in historical and social analysis and expository writing.
授業方法: Face to face format. Lectures, presentations, essays. Zoom lessons for students who have received permission to study online.
